content.raw:
Looks like threading causes the pose of the model to be off sync when `GetWorldPose()` is called.  Here's relevant snapshot of log from running the `DropStuff` test:
~~~
Dbg cylinder time [0.218] sim z [10.2613] exact z [10.2613] sim vz [-2.18] exact vz [-2.18]
Dbg cylinder time [0.219] sim z [10.2591] exact z [10.2591] sim vz [-2.19] exact vz [-2.19]
Dbg cylinder time [0.22] sim z [10.2591] exact z [10.2569] sim vz [-2.2] exact vz [-2.2]
/home/hsu/projects/gazebo_precon/test/regression/physics.cc:131: Failure
Expected: (fabs(pose.pos.z - z)) < (0.0001), actual: 0.0022 vs 0.0001
Dbg cylinder time [0.221] sim z [10.2547] exact z [10.2547] sim vz [-2.21] exact vz [-2.21]
Dbg cylinder time [0.222] sim z [10.2525] exact z [10.2525] sim vz [-2.22] exact vz [-2.22]
Dbg cylinder time [0.223] sim z [10.2502] exact z [10.2502] sim vz [-2.23] exact vz [-2.23]
~~~
It looks like pose at sim time = 0.22, cylinder pose was not updated in time for the test, it's got the same pose as for t = 0.219 sec.

Declining this pull request for now, issue #698 filed.

Looks like threading causes the pose of the model to be off sync when GetWorldPose() is called. Here's relevant snapshot of log from running the DropStuff test:

Dbg cylinder time [0.218] sim z [10.2613] exact z [10.2613] sim vz [-2.18] exact vz [-2.18]
Dbg cylinder time [0.219] sim z [10.2591] exact z [10.2591] sim vz [-2.19] exact vz [-2.19]
Dbg cylinder time [0.22] sim z [10.2591] exact z [10.2569] sim vz [-2.2] exact vz [-2.2]
/home/hsu/projects/gazebo_precon/test/regression/physics.cc:131: Failure
Expected: (fabs(pose.pos.z - z)) < (0.0001), actual: 0.0022 vs 0.0001
Dbg cylinder time [0.221] sim z [10.2547] exact z [10.2547] sim vz [-2.21] exact vz [-2.21]
Dbg cylinder time [0.222] sim z [10.2525] exact z [10.2525] sim vz [-2.22] exact vz [-2.22]
Dbg cylinder time [0.223] sim z [10.2502] exact z [10.2502] sim vz [-2.23] exact vz [-2.23]

It looks like pose at sim time = 0.22, cylinder pose was not updated in time for the test, it's got the same pose as for t = 0.219 sec.

Declining this pull request for now, issue #698 filed.
